conclusion: To determine whether the accelerations of both objects are first increasing and then decreasing, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graphs for objects A and B. Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which can be determined by the slope of the v-t graph.
The slope of the v-t graph at any point gives the acceleration at that instant.
A positive slope indicates positive acceleration (speeding up). A negative slope indicates negative acceleration (slowing down). A zero slope indicates constant velocity (no acceleration).
From t = 0 to t = t1, the graph for object A shows a curve that starts at the origin and reaches a peak at t1.

premise: The slope of the v-t graph at any point gives the acceleration at that instant.
conclusion: Initially, the slope for object A is positive and increasing, indicating increasing acceleration.

premise: The slope of the v-t graph at any point gives the acceleration at that instant.
conclusion: As the graph for object A reaches the peak, the slope starts to decrease, indicating decreasing acceleration.
At t = t1, the slope for object A is zero, indicating zero acceleration.
From t = 0 to t = t1, the graph for object B also shows a curve that starts at the origin and reaches a peak at t1.

premise: The slope of the v-t graph at any point gives the acceleration at that instant.
conclusion: Initially, the slope for object B is positive and increasing, indicating increasing acceleration.

premise: The slope of the v-t graph at any point gives the acceleration at that instant.
conclusion: As the graph for object B reaches the peak, the slope starts to decrease, indicating decreasing acceleration.
At t = t1, the slope for object B is zero, indicating zero acceleration.

premise: Both objects A and B exhibit a pattern where their accelerations first increase and then decrease over the time interval from t = 0 to t = t1.
conclusion: Yes, the accelerations of both objects are first increasing and then decreasing during the time interval from t = 0 to t = t1.
